info.name: Gracile tubercle
info.description: The gracile tubercle is a small bump or elevation on the dorsomedial surface of the medulla, created by the underlying gracile nucleus. Tactile, vibratory and proprioceptive input from the lower body and lower extremity travels via the gracile fasciculus of the dorsal or posterior funiculus of the spinal cord to synapse in the gracile nucleus.
info.item: /Gross/Brain stem & Cerebellum/Brain stem/8 Brain stem - dorsal view
